name: Woolly Bugger - Black
description: The classic all-around streamer. Effective in virtually any water condition.
recipe:
Hook: 4-10 3XL streamer
Thread: Black 6/0
Tail: Black marabou
Body: Black chenille
Hackle: Black saddle

name: Woolly Bugger - Olive
description: Olive variation imitates leeches and baitfish. Great in stained water.
recipe:
Hook: 4-10 3XL streamer
Thread: Olive 6/0
Tail: Olive marabou
Body: Olive chenille
Hackle: Grizzly saddle

name: Muddler Minnow
description: Classic sculpin imitation. Deadly when stripped along the bottom.
recipe:
Hook: 4-8 3XL streamer
Thread: Brown 6/0
Tail: Turkey quill
Body: Gold tinsel
Wing: Turkey quill
Head: Spun deer hair

name: Zonker - White
description: Rabbit strip creates incredible action. Imitates baitfish perfectly.
recipe:
Hook: 2-6 3XL streamer
Thread: White 6/0
Body: Pearl mylar
Wing: White rabbit strip
Collar: White hackle

name: Pheasant Tail Nymph
description: Legendary mayfly nymph pattern. A must-have in every fly box.
recipe:
Hook: 12-18 nymph
Thread: Brown 8/0
Tail: Pheasant tail fibers
Body: Pheasant tail fibers
Thorax: Peacock herl
Wingcase: Pheasant tail

name: Hare's Ear Nymph
description: Buggy profile imitates many aquatic insects. Highly effective pattern.
recipe:
Hook: 10-16 nymph
Thread: Brown 8/0
Tail: Hare's mask guard hairs
Body: Hare's ear dubbing
Rib: Gold tinsel
Wingcase: Turkey quill

name: Prince Nymph
description: Attractor pattern that triggers strikes. The white wings are key.
recipe:
Hook: 10-16 nymph
Thread: Black 8/0
Tail: Brown goose biots
Body: Peacock herl
Rib: Gold tinsel
Wings: White goose biots
Hackle: Brown hen

name: Adams Dry Fly
description: The most versatile dry fly ever created. If you only carry one dry, make it an Adams.
recipe:
Hook: 12-18 dry fly
Thread: Gray 8/0
Tail: Mixed grizzly/brown hackle fibers
Body: Muskrat dubbing
Wing: Grizzly hen tips
Hackle: Mixed grizzly/brown

name: Elk Hair Caddis
description: Essential caddis imitation. Floats like a cork and drives fish crazy.
recipe:
Hook: 12-18 dry fly
Thread: Tan 8/0
Body: Hare's ear dubbing
Hackle: Brown, palmered
Wing: Elk hair

name: Royal Wulff
description: High-floating attractor pattern. Visible in rough water and low light.
recipe:
Hook: 10-16 dry fly
Thread: Black 8/0
Tail: Elk hair
Body: Peacock herl/red floss/peacock herl
Wing: White calf tail
Hackle: Brown
